title: 109_hr3775
content: The Act is titled the "John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor Reauthorization Act of 2005". It pertains to the reauthorization of the John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor. The John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor Reauthorization Act of 2005 is amending the Commission Membership by increasing the number of members to 25, updating the name of the Massachusetts department, and adjusting the number of representatives and individuals nominated by the Governors of Massachusetts and Rhode Island. The John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor Reauthorization Act of 2005 is amending the Commission Membership by increasing the number of members to 25, updating the name of the Massachusetts department, and adjusting the number of representatives and individuals nominated by the Governors of Massachusetts and Rhode Island. The amendment includes appointing 1 individual from Massachusetts and 1 individual from Rhode Island to represent non-governmental organizations with expertise in various fields such as historic preservation, conservation, outdoor recreation, cultural conservation, traditional arts, community development, and tourism. Additionally, the quorum requirement is increased to thirteen members of the Commission. The Commission will update the plan within 2 years, considering findings from the Sustainability Study Report. The update will include performance goals, resource protection options, and sustainable partnership strategies. The Secretary will approve or disapprove changes to the plan proposed in the update, excluding minor revisions, in accordance with subsection (b). Public Law 99-647 is amending section 7 to extend the Commission. The Commission will terminate 10 years after the enactment of the John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor Reauthorization Act of 2005. Authorization of appropriations is increased to $1,000,000 and $10,000,000 is authorized for development funds for fiscal years 2006 through 2016. Additionally, a special resource study is mandated. The Secretary must complete a special resource study within 3 years to evaluate sites in the Blackstone River Valley related to the American Industrial Revolution. This includes assessing the feasibility of designating sites within the John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor as part of the National Park System and coordinating preservation efforts with various entities. The Secretary will coordinate the study with the John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor Commission. A report must be submitted to the House Committee on Resources and the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 30 days of completing the study, detailing the findings, conclusions, and recommendations. Appropriations are authorized for the study.
